ExampleDefinition.Title: Gaps in Series
ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates discontinuous lines series and column series, where gaps can be inserted into the chart by using double.NaN
ExampleDefinition.Description: <Run FontSize="14" FontWeight="Bold">Gaps in Series</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13">Demonstrates how double.NaN can be used to render gaps or continuous lines in a line or column chart. See the source code for this example to understand how we did this.</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontWeight="Bold" FontStyle="Italic">Interactivity Options</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontStyle="Italic"> - Drag X-Axis to scale.</Run> <LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontStyle="Italic"> - Drag Y-Axis to scale.</Run> <LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontStyle="Italic"> - Double click to zoom to extents.</Run>
